mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Preston, D. R.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Relations acquired property of his father unjustly; always been interested in books and poetry; taught himself Latin and French; encloses printed "Proposal for printing an interesting work, entitled the wonders of creation"; has had indifferent success in obtaining subscribers; also encloses poetry clippings from Aegis. [2 enclosures].
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1805 October 10, Boston, [Massachusetts] to Thomas Jefferson, Washington [D.C.].
